meanings.definition: Relating to the geography of ancient times.
meanings.sent1: The paleogeographical map showed where ancient rivers once flowed.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use paleogeographical data to understand how the Earth looked in the past.
meanings.sent3: The paleogeographical puzzle was challenging but fun to solve.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a paleogeographical landscape, filled with memories of bygone days.
meanings.sent5: The paleogeographical images painted a vivid picture of the world long ago.

meanings.definition: Study of the geographical features of past eras.
meanings.sent1: Paleogeographical involves examining old maps and fossils.
meanings.sent2: The paleogeographical of dinosaurs helps us learn about their habitats.
meanings.sent3: During the paleogeographical class, we explored ancient terrains in detail.
meanings.sent4: His room was a paleogeographical museum, filled with artifacts from different epochs.
meanings.sent5: The paleogeographical research shed light on the Earth's history.

meanings.definition: Describing the land formations of prehistoric periods.
meanings.sent1: The paleogeographical rocks revealed secrets of the past.
meanings.sent2: The paleogeographical layers showed evidence of ancient seas.
meanings.sent3: The paleogeographical terrain looked like a giant fossil playground.
meanings.sent4: Her imagination painted a paleogeographical picture of the ancient world.
meanings.sent5: The paleogeographical landscape was a time capsule of prehistoric wonders.
